meanings.definition: To beat or strike with a whip or similar object.
meanings.sent1: He tried to whup the rug to get rid of the dust.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy had to whup the horse to make it run faster.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to whup the cream to make a delicious dessert.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to whup the sails, propelling the boat forward.
meanings.sent5: She had to whup the eggs to make a fluffy omelette.

meanings.definition: To defeat decisively in a competition or fight.
meanings.sent1: The team managed to whup their opponents in the final match.
meanings.sent2: He was determined to whup his fear of heights by climbing the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it could whup the dog in a race around the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed seemed to whup any obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was able to whup the villain and save the city.
